body:
I like the idea of being able to register multiple representations, there should be a clear mechanism to decide which one to use if multiple representations can represent the same type, thinking out loud: custom representation of type would have priority over assertj ones, it's a bit trickier if multiple custom representations provide representation for the same types.

 @filiphr suggested implementation seems to be simpler ;-)

>there should be a clear mechanism to decide which one to use if multiple representations can represent the same type, thinking out loud: custom representation of type would have priority over assertj ones, it's a bit trickier if multiple custom representations provide representation for the same types.

1. We can add `int getPriority` with a default implementation to `Representation` that way in case multiple implementations provide a representation they would need to handle it. I don't think that AssertJ should worry about that. AssertJ would order them once it loads them through the service loader.

2. We can always add the default representation from AssertJ in the end of the list. This would make sure that everything works smoothly. If a custom implementation wants to change something in the default one they only need to provide their own implementation that handles that.
I agree adding a priority should be good enough, there is always a risk of collision in the priority values but easy to address.
Hi! I wonder whether this issue is still open. If it is, I would like to work on this issue. ðŸ˜Š

thanks @Annette0127, go for it!
I think at the moment we can try @filiphr approach.

Sorry I never circled back to comment on this issue...

I think the main difference between my original suggestion and @filiphr 's proposal is the backing structure - I was proposing a HashMap for O(1) lookup, and @filiphr is proposing a simple collection for O(n) lookup. Given that n is likely to be very small, I can't imagine a massive performance gain by using a hash, so I'm comfortable with @filiphr 's suggestion as being (probably) simpler to implement and maintain. But also, both proposals could work with the same API design for custom representations, so it would be easy to switch to a hash-based lookup in the future in the unlikely event that it was necessary to do so for performance.
@Annette0127 can you raise a PR in draft mode? it's easier to provide feedback that way.

issue.title: CompositeRepresentation and CompositeRepresentation_Test draft.

repository.name: assertj
repository.description: Fluent testing assertions for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
#### Check List:
* Fixes #2048
* Unit tests : YES 
* Javadoc with a code example (on API only) : NO

Maybe the method `String unambiguousToStringOf(Object object)` from the ''org.assertj.core.presentation.Representation.java'' is no longer needed since multiple `Representation` can be implemented in the class `CompositeRepresentation`.
